author: Audrey
text: 'Lots of great dishes! Very nice staff. Excellent neighborhood spot. Reasonably priced. Would recommend for sure.'

text: 'Delicious moroccan-french cuisine in a romantic

author: Jenny Lukose
text: "Loved the vibes plus the waiters and staff were super friendly- you could tell they actually care about your dining experience. The food itself was why I reduced the star- it was good but nothing crazy. We felt like it wasn't seasoned enough but maybe that's just our personal preference. I'd still recommend it because it's such a cute place."

author: Ryan McLaughlin
text: "Service was good but thats about it.\n\nFood in general is extremely bland. My friend and I ordered the traditional couscous bowl as suggested but it was so dry it was practically inedible. After adding 2 bowls of broth
column5: which also lacked any real flavor
column6: we just stopped eating.\n\nWhen asked about why we didn't like it one of the managers suggested another (3rd bowl) of broth. Didn't seem to understand that neither the bowl nor broth had any flavor."

author: Janvi Sharma
text: 'Thurs
column5: fri
column6: sat evenings they have live musicians that make the dining experience so much fun. Great interactions with staff as well
column7: can‚Äôt wait to come back and try more of the menu!'

author: Rebeca Rozenbaum
text: 'Good food
column5: service and ambiance! They had live music which made the experience even better! Would be coming back for sure!'

author: Zack Mejias
text: 'Very friendly service and great menu! Really nice outdoor dining area too. If you‚Äôre looking for a unique Hoboken spot this is a good choice.'

author: Kelli Callahan
text: 'Hidden gem in Hoboken! This is exactly what our little city needed - some quality restaurant diversity. The food
column5: staff & vibe  were a 10/10. I‚Äôm not one to write reviews but this was worthy. Lisa and Omar the owners work their butts off and the staff is like family. We will DEFINITELY be back!'

author: c warnp
text: "First off let me say that I'm here visiting from Memphis
column5: TN. I did not know what type of vibe I was walking into. All I know was that I was HUNGRY!!!! When I walked inside I realized it was a causal dress type vibe and after reading the menu
column6: reservations are to be made. I cod also be wrong about that. However
column7: they welcome us with open arms!!!! What I love the most more than the food
column8: is the family atmosphere. They actually sit down together and eat together. I love that!!! But this LAMB though.....so freaking tender and the combination of seasoning
column9: I can't even explain. Please try is all I can say. Drinks are so different in a good way!!! I will definitely come back and recommend!! Thanks for a great experience!!!!"

author: Nancy Chung
text:
"Excellent service!!
The owner came by and shared his story of opening up this location.  He was so warm and welcoming and the staff were so wonderful too!  They actually waited until we were DONE with our appetizers to bring the main course out!
it's the little things that add up that make you fall in love with this place.
My friend and i got the trio appetizer
column5: cheese platter and kale salad and 1 entree.  This was plenty of food for us!!"

author: E M
text: 'We tried Barbes for the first time last weekend and had a great experience. Our waiter made great recommendations and the cocktails were amazing also. This will definitely be a spot we come back to'

author: John C. Fusi
text: 'Very good and authentic Mediterranean food
column5: and attentive service.  Will definitely return again.'

author: Karen Nemet-Nejat
text: 'I have been to this restaurant many times. The food is excellent. The appetizers are prepared according to Moroccan Cuisine
column5: just the correct amount of spice and herbs. The main dishes are also various and well-prepared. The only disappointing item is the vegetables with couscous in which the assortment of vegetables are few. The desserts vary; they are great and interesting. The proportions of foods served are generous. There is a full bar. Finally
column6: the service is perfect! They are attentive to customer‚Äôs needs without spending too much time at the table. This is one of the few restaurants did not raise prices since CoVid lockdown. Try it for yourself.'

author: Kushal Berera
text: 'Excellent food. Make a reservation before you go. It‚Äôs a popular spot.'

author: Judy Luo
text:
"We dined indoors.
Live jazz music on Friday night: A+
Ambiance: A
Food: B- our entrees (lamb tagine
column5: couscous) were extremely underseasoned and the baklava dessert was mediocre. Steamed mussels were yummy.\nDrinks: A\nService: B- nice servers
column6: but very slow and seemed chaotic. It took 30 min? to get my second cocktail. The restaurant looked short staffed considering total number of diners.\nConclusion: I'll just enjoy at the bar next time üòÅ"

author: Valentina Locatelli
text: 'This is the second time I dine here and I got back to give the place a second chance to surprise me!\nTuesday night
column6: me and my girl friend go there for dinner.\nWe order one appetizer (delicious) and two entrees. I asked if the spicy sauce can be on the side or completely removed
column7: if not I\'d order something else. The waiter noted that down and said "absolutely no problem".\nAt 8:45 the waiter comes out saying that there is a delay in the kitchen and our meal would be out soon - no big deal we were having a good time.\nAt 9:20 the entrees got out brought by someone that was not the waiter
column8: her is perfect and very good. Mine is floating in harissa sauce. At that point I ate most of the couscous that wasn\'t soaked (and that was good) but couldn\'t have the whole meal because of the spiciness.\nThe waiter then came and asked how everything was and I said that probably something went wrong in the kitchen and that his note got lost
column9:
we went back in to check and few minutes after came out apologizing of the mistake.
No big deal again we were having a good time.
Just before leaving (10:30pm) he came out once more asking (and here I am quoting) "do you have a dessert for your netflix show tonight? or can i pack some baklawa for you?"
I thought that was very nice so we said yes! the doggy bag came out and few minutes after the check....
They charged us for the whole meal (which is fine even if they made a mistake on my order) AND for the baklawa to go!!!
I let the reader draw conclusions but I'm sure I won't give the place a third chance.'

author: Pearl Stars
text: 'Big bright clean place with good food and friendly staff. Drop by for brunch.'

author: Mark Guerrieri
text: 'Great food
column5: great live music
column6: overall great vibe!'

author: James Bond
text: 'Tasty Moroccan cuisine with a great atmosphere and informative servers.'

author: Michael Ahrendt
text: "Some of the best food in Hoboken. The tangine d'agneau was incredible. Cocktails were exceptional as was the service. Great dinner ambiance really set the mood for a Saturday date night. Can't wait to come back."

author: Dominique Bession
text: 'Wide variety of dishes
column5: great service

author: Andrew G
text: 'Excellent merguez sausages
column5: among everything else. Great service.'

author: Matthew Jacobs
text: 'Really bad brunch experience. Service was disorganized
column5: staff interrupted our conversation and one of our glasses was filthy.\n\nMy wife ordered lamb medium-well
column6: it came out rare so we sent it back and when it came out again it was still rare. As it was the end of our meal and we asked them to take it off our bill but they refused even though my wife couldn‚Äôt eat it.\n\nWe told them we live right round the corner and it  totally baffles me why they would lose a customer who lives so close over $15'

author: Natalina Med
text: 'It was my first time today visiting this great place. The food is very delicioous. The place is nice. The staff is super nice and friendly. Great hospitality and great management.'

author: Hilary Pinn
text: 'Would have enjoyed it more with fewer tables...felt very crowded.  Live music was very good but added to the noise level which was deafening.  Food was good.  Service ok.  Would sit outside next time.  Moroccan dishes were very good.'

text: 'Is like traditional French and Moroccan restaurants

text: 'AMAZING

text: "This place is a such a great find. Very authentic french morrocan food. We really enjoyed every dish especially the shawarma. They really need to get a better bar tender."

text: 'It was the worst experience I‚Äôve ever had in a restaurant. I wanna say they are understaffed

text: 'Went there on a breezy summer evening

column8:
and well priced. And the dessert was very authentic.

Romantic setting with great indoors and outdoors.

Very deserving of 5 stars

author: Prajit Chhabra
text: 'Exceptional on all accounts - food
column5: cocktails
column6: service
column7: and ambiance which included a live jazz band. I relish French cuisine and during my visit to Marrakech I fell in love Moroccan food. This restaurant brings a blend of both to Hoboken. The escargot were delish and so was the chicken tagine. The cocktails were top notch.'

author: Christopher Dellisanti
text: 'We had an amazing dinner and ambience. Great music and service !'

author: Uma Moiseenko
text: 'Such a lovely

author: Sidney Suggs
text: 'Workers were not wearing masks correctly. Did not feel very covid friendly. Very pushy when it came time to order. After sitting down for 5 minutes four workers asked if we wanted to order. Food was mediocre.'

author: Tamar Amitay
text: 'What a delicious meal WOW am I actually eating such incredible food in Hoboken? My NYC  foodie sensibilities are thrilled to have stumbled on Barbes! We enjoyed the most delicious meal - don‚Äôt miss the shrimp crevette or rack of lamb! Finish w the chocolate mousse and mint tea. I can‚Äôt wait to return as the tangines- all look tantalizing . Merci bien Barbes for restoring my faith that there are wonderful restaurants to be discovered in Hoboken'

Nice service
Will try this place for dinner next time.'

author: Piush K
text: 'Amazing brunch options with a fusion of French and Moroccan cuisines.'

author: Sabrina Browne
text: 'Barbes is the best French-Moroccan restaurant in the city of Hoboken!\n\nThe food is absolutely exquisite and seasoned to perfection
column5: allowing all the flavors to melt in your mouth for a memorable experience. I absolutely love the Saumon Grille and Steak Au Poivre
column6: as main courses. While the Mac and Cheese is the best I‚Äôve had in Hudson County ‚Äî if not the state of New Jersey. Barbes will delight on any occasion
column7: whether you‚Äôre looking for boozy brunch or date night!'

text: 'Truly unique

author: Laura Guldner
text: 'What a wonderful experience! Exceptional service. Delicious fresh food. Live music. Romantic ambiance. We had hummus and lamb. Highly recommend this place. Thank you for a magical evening!'

column5:
incredible. Couscous and Tagines are very good. Thank you for the very good dinner. I will be back.

author: cornell Hodge
text: 'I enjoyed eating here'

author: Greg Merritt
text: 'Fun place
column5: great food
column6: great service. Make a reservation

author: Will Griffith
text: 'Wonderful time
column5: could not have been happier
column6: our waitress; Nazareth was an absolute delight.\nSecond time around
column7: also amazing

author: Zoe Perry
text: 'Could not have had a better experience. Our waiter was outstanding and the food was amazing. The drinks were out of this world -- cannot recommend enough!'

author: Russ Terry
text:
"I'm stunned this place has great reviews! My pal and I had an awful experience. I would've given them a 1 but my friend is nice and he said 2. Here are the many ways it was bad:
- Charged us for 2 drinks from the next table. Neither of us even drink alcohol.
- Charged me for tea I didn't order.
- Brought out the side dishes when we were halfway through our meal. My dish was bland without the side dishes
column5: which was why I ordered them when I placed my order.\n- Our outdoor dining table didn't have a heater like all the others
column6: even though we made a reservation.\nPlenty of much better restaurants in Hoboken."

author: Sean Moriarty
text: 'What an awesome dinner. Loved it! Started w amazing hummus... Tagines are out of this üåé. Stellar desserts. Add great wine and friendly service and you have a great night. Oh. And Madonna is there to watch over you. A Hoboken gem. Go!!'

author: Stef Stangl
text: 'Jymmy is the best!!!! The food is delicious !!'

author: Andrew Wong
text: 'Amazing French restaurant. Good for first timers. Service was amazing
column5: wait staff was attentive even thought they had a full house. Food was to die for. Definitely recommend'

author: Laurie Batista
text: 'GREAT neighborhood spot. Great brunch menu and great service. Felt like I was back in Paris for a few. Out door dining is also socially distanced nicely.'

author: Aov Aov
text: 'A treasure in Hoboken.....when you enter....The ambiance
column5: cordiality
column6: amazing jazz music transports you to Paris!!! To an authentic French bistro with a delicious Moroccan flair!!   Friendly and attentive staff
column7: wonderful service
column8: visits from the owners to say hello and check on everything...happy
column10: energetic atmosphere....jazz was super cool.. ...got  the patrons clapping!!! And the food.....omg...one dish better than the other....and be sure to have the authentic Morroccan tea!!! Served tableside....with a flair!!!  Perfectly paired with the pastilla dessert.....A must go to for a fun and delicious evening!!!!'

author: Regina Nepsha
text: 'The food is amazing
column5: staff very warm and friendly. Outdoor heat lamps and covered area make it possible to support them during these cold months. Was very comfortable out there!'

author: Shawn E
text: 'I love Barb√®s
column5: not only is the food authentic and delicious
column6: but the best part about this place is that you feel as though you‚Äôre on a cozy and luxurious holiday. Customer service like nowhere else and the best food in town. Must try dishes include the Hummus
column7: the burger
column9: and for dessert the chocolate mousse.'

author: Jordelin Lopez
text: 'The service and food is AMAZING. The prices are great. The manager gave my friend (the birthday girl) a Barbes blanket as a gift! Our server was Jimmy and he was so nice and catering to us. The drinks were great
column5: I recommend the Naughty & Nice! I had shawarma
column6: hummus
column7: and quinoa salad which were all amazing. Come here!'

author: STUART WEINER
text: "In 62 years
column5: one of the most enjoyable
column6: entertaining and delicious dinners I have ever had!!!    The best service ever!!! Our waiters treated us with such attention to detail and made sure we were happy with each dish. Every dish we have tried so far
column7: and we intend to come back often to try everything
column8: every dish was just perfection.   Kudos to the entire staff for bringing such a great experience during difficult times...Live music too!!! If I could give more than five stars I would do so. Fantastic and fabulous!!! Can't wait to see everyone again!!!  Stuart"

author: Darwin Cipion
text: 'I had a terrible experience here. They offered me a table outside in the cold and the heater at my table didn‚Äôt have gas. I asked them to moved inside the restaurant which they did after 45 minutes. Once inside I placed my order and I asked the waiter for Quinoa instead of fries because I can‚Äôt eat fry foods. The next thing he does? He brings me a whole plate of fries. I asked him to replace my order with another dish which he didn‚Äôt. I try to get someone to notice me to change my order and everyone was busy with other tables. The manager noticed me after a while and came to my table and took the replacement order which took forever. The only reason I stayed is because I was with my fianc√© and she was starving and try our best to make the best of the situation after all it was our anniversary. I didn‚Äôt touch the lamb dish with the fries and asked them to remove it and they still made me pay for. It was the worst experience I‚Äôve ever had in a restaurant. I wanna say they are understaffed
column5: because if that‚Äôs how they treat guess they should not be in business. They should get more people to better their service. The place looks nice but the service it‚Äôs the worst. The manager/owner tries his best to make people welcome but the rest of the staff doesn‚Äôt.'

author: Cristina Tenaglia
text: 'Delicious food
column5: everything fresh and authentic - as if you are invited to dinner at the home of an exceptionally good cook! Warm staff and beautiful ambience.'

author: Mary Wright
text: 'Food great. Service great. Atmosphere perfect. Great part of Hoboken. There is no way you will be disappointed.'

author: Adrian John
text: 'Premier place in Hoboken. One of our absolute favorites. A delicious mix of Mediterranean and French. Omar the owner is incredible. Our favorite waitress is Gaby. Must try the Salade Mediterrane. Perfect for date night as well.'

author: Jeffrey Richman
text: 'One of my favorite spots in Hoboken
column5: especially on Thurs/Fri/Sat night when they have the live music. Great food
column6: great vibe
column7: and very friendly staff.'

author: J Crowell
text: "This restaurant really needs to update their hours on their website and on Google. They are no longer open until Midnight. They close at 9 pm! I drove 20 minutes to eat at this restaurant
column5: I paid for parking at the closest parking garage
column6: and once I got there at 9 pm they refused to seat me and told me that they close earlier now because of the Pandemic. Well
column7: the Pandemic has been happening since March. That was 9 months ago. So you're telling me it's been 9 months and they still haven't yet updated their hours on their website or on Google? What a disappointing first impression of a restaurant I was looking forward to eating at. I think it's about time they updated the hours on the website so that more people don't have this same negative experience and bad impression. They've had plenty of time to update their website. How much longer is it going to take?"

author: valon loshaj
text: 'Great ambiance
column5: amazing food and such a hospitable team of people. Thumbs up all around!'

author: Joseph Tierney
text: 'Really wanted to to like this place. Our waitress was very kind and personable
column5: which was the only highlight of the experience. ‚Ä¶'

author: Javier Vazquez Caputo
text: 'Amazing french-maroccan food
column5: beautiful ambiance and setup and great service from a  friendly staff. Truly enjoyable experience in Hoboken!'

author: Osborn Focht
text: 'Very sweet place. Great service. Good wine selection. The white meat in the tagine was overcooked. I will go back.'
